tweets.text:
$1.6T stablecoins by 2030 is much too small of an estimate (assuming US legislation passes this year).

Tune into my keynote at 
@token2049
 on exactly this topic & my own formula/reasoning. 

Spoiler: it’s higher than Citi’s estimate.

1/ On April 29th at noon PST, Frax takes the next step in our evolution with the North Star Upgrade 

With this update, Frax Share will be renamed simply to Frax, become the gas token for Fraxtal, & be the sole commodity token utilized for security in the ecosystem forever.

Tend to agree with this take verbatim down to the punctuation mark. Two biggest opportunities the next decade & likely the century:

1) SoV Crypto+Stablecoins (aka permissionless money)
2) Sovereign AI/onchain inference (aka permissionless intelligence)

is there anyone trying to make Ethereum *less* complex?

or are we just adding things without realizing that each new thing requires maintenance and cognitive overhead for new entrants to learn about?

at some point we're going to collapse under the weight of our own complexity

Super excited to be joining 
@fraxfinance
 as VP of Strategic Initiatives & Alliances.

After spending the last 4 years building 
@kado_money
 and living on the front lines of the crypto payments world, one thing has become crystal clear to me: stablecoins are the future.

Now is the

This has been my thesis: Ethereum the network is amazing & going to be the major issuance ledger of the world. But very little, if any, of that value will be captured by the $ETH asset (due to ETH pivoting to a P/E DCF tech stock model). Empirical validation:

Not saying I'm Nostradamus but...
Me: Circle needs a chain+token, incomplete business without one, IPO is disappointing.

Circle: cancels IPO, announces investment in stablecoin-only chain Codex.

Sam thesis validated.
